programme.title: Recita del Rosario
programme.sub-title: Dalla basilica papale di Santa Maria Maggiore in Roma
programme.desc: Dalla cappella della 'Salus Populi Romani', la preghiera dei misteri da parte del clero locale.

programme.title: L'ora solare
programme.desc: Storie di chi ha scelto di non arrendersi e si affida alla speranza: vicende difficili in famiglia e in amore, atti di fede, di impegno civile e sociale, di fratellanza. Una occasione di conoscenza e confronto.

programme.title: Siamo noi
programme.desc: Un programma dedicato all'Italia che non si arrende, che crede nelle relazioni, promuove la solidarietà, crea soluzioni, condivide conoscenze e costruisce angoli di futuro.

programme.title: In cammino
programme.desc: Attraverso temi e ospiti diversi, si racconta il cammino della Chiesa verso il Sinodo, istituzione permanente del Collegio episcopale della Chiesa cattolica, fondato da Papa Paolo VI il 15 settembre 1965.

programme.title: Evance e Francesco
programme.desc: Papa Francesco incontra il piccolo Evance per un dialogo fatto di speranza, conforto ed affetto, con l'intento di regalare a tutti i bambini del mondo l'amore per la vita.

programme.title: Il mio medico
programme.desc: Programma di informazione medica a servizio dei cittadini pensato per diffondere una cultura della salute basata sulla prevenzione, attraverso un linguaggio accessibile e l'ascolto del proprio corpo.

programme.title: Vediamoci chiaro
programme.desc: Scopriamo insieme tutti i consigli e le opinioni su come tutelare i cittadini, e alcuni suggerimenti e soluzioni ai piccoli e grandi problemi delle famiglie.

programme.title: Borghi d'Italia
programme.desc: Un viaggio sul territorio con lo sguardo rivolto alle persone, all'ambiente, al paesaggio al folklore. I borghi italiani visti come comunità e traino semplice, ma forte, di un intero territorio; il tutto dal vivo.

programme.title: Recita del Rosario
programme.desc: L'appuntamento con la riflessione, la meditazione e la recita dei misteri del rosario.

programme.title: In cammino
programme.desc: Attraverso temi e ospiti diversi, si racconta il cammino della Chiesa verso il Sinodo, istituzione permanente del Collegio episcopale della Chiesa cattolica, fondato da Papa Paolo VI il 15 settembre 1965.

programme.title: Preghiera del mattino
programme.desc: Un momento collettivo di riflessione e spiritualità, che va dal Credo al Padre Nostro.

programme.title: Recita del Rosario
programme.desc: L'appuntamento con la riflessione, la meditazione e la recita dei misteri del rosario.

programme.title: Di buon mattino
programme.desc: I due conduttori ci parlano di attualità, economia, costume, spettacolo, musica, cucina, curiosità, religione e feste popolari. In studio, insieme a loro, sono presenti anche ospiti ed esperti per discutere dei temi più vari.

programme.title: TG 2000 Flash
programme.desc: Un'edizione rapida del telegiornale, per gli aggiornamenti sulle informazioni più importanti in materia di cronaca, politica, cultura, società e sport, a cura della redazione giornalistica della rete.

programme.title: Santa Messa
programme.desc: In diretta dalla Basilica di San Pietro in Vaticano, la Santa Messa celebrata dal Sua Santità, Papa Francesco.

programme.title: Di buon mattino
programme.desc: I due conduttori ci parlano di attualità, economia, costume, spettacolo, musica, cucina, curiosità, religione e feste popolari. In studio, insieme a loro, sono presenti anche ospiti ed esperti per discutere dei temi più vari.

programme.title: Udienza generale del Santo Padre
programme.desc: Il mercoledì mattina, con cadenza settimanale, il Papa saluta e si rivolge a un gruppo di pellegrini cristiani, devoti e visitatori. Il luogo dell'appuntamento è Piazza San Pietro, a Roma.

programme.title: Di buon mattino

programme.desc: Prepariamo pasta alla norcina con lime, torta salata allo yogurt e frappe di nonna Viviana.

programme.title: Angelus
programme.desc: Il pontefice celebra il rito per i fedeli di tutto il mondo cristiano cattolico.

programme.title: Marina
programme.desc: La storia d'amore tra Alex, giovane avvocato, e Marina, aspirante stilista, ostacolata dal rancore che divide le rispettive famiglie.

programme.title: Coroncina alla Divina Misericordia
programme.desc: Seguiamo insieme la recita della preghiera devozionale, ideata nel 1935 da suor Faustina Kowalska. I versi sono ispirati dalla visione di un angelo di cui la santa fu testimone durante la sua vita.

programme.title: Di Bella sul 28
programme.desc: Il punto a metà settimana, con approfondimenti sui temi dell'attualità italiana e internazionale. Per avere una visione più chiara dei fatti, il conduttore dialoga con gli ospiti in studio e propone collegamenti, servizi giornalistici e sondaggi.

programme.title: The Chosen
programme.desc: Un'esplorazione della vita di Gesù, raccontata attraverso gli occhi e la prospettiva privilegiata di coloro che hanno avuto la possibilità di incontrarlo e di interagire con lui.

programme.title: La compieta, preghiera della sera
programme.desc: Le monache agostiniane del convento dei Santi Quattro Coronati in Roma recitano la compieta, preghiera della sera che comprende un salmo, una breve lettura e il cantico di Zaccaria.

programme.desc: Un documentario dedicato a Carlo Borromeo, cardinale e arcivescovo venerato come santo dalla Chiesa cattolica, canonizzato nel 1610 da papa Paolo V a soli 26 anni dalla morte.

programme.title: Una ragazza, un maggiordomo e una lady
programme.desc: Un'orfanella americana viene spacciata da un truffatore come nipote ereditiera di una nobile signora inglese.

programme.title: Guerra e pace
programme.desc: Settimanale di approfondimento dedicato alla cronaca estera. Con l'aiuto di due esperti portatori di punti di vista differenti, il presentatore ricostruisce e approfondisce le ragioni dei principali eventi internazionali.

programme.title: Il sapore della libertà
programme.desc: Esploriamo il mondo del carcere femminile. In ogni puntata una donna racconta la sua vita prima del carcere, il motivo per cui è detenuta, il percorso di rieducazione e reintegrazione, e il suo rapporto con gli affetti lasciati all'esterno.

programme.desc: Attraverso temi e ospiti diversi, si racconta il cammino della Chiesa verso il Sinodo, istituzione permanente del Collegio episcopale della Chiesa cattolica, fondato da Papa Paolo VI il 15 settembre 1965.

programme.title: I Santi
programme.desc: Un documentario dedicato alla storia di San Giovanni Paolo II, eletto Papa il 16 ottobre 1978. A maggio 2011 viene proclamato beato dal suo successore, Benedetto XVI. Ad aprile 2014, Papa Francesco lo proclama Santo.

programme.title: Federico II di Svevia
programme.desc: Documentario dedicato alla mirabile figura di Federico II di Hohenstaufen, morto nel 1250, uno dei più eclettici e determinanti personaggi della storia medievale, precursore, per certi versi, di una idea al tutto nuova di uomo.

programme.title: Il mio medico
programme.desc: Programma di informazione medica a servizio dei cittadini pensato per diffondere una cultura della salute basata sulla prevenzione, attraverso un linguaggio accessibile e l'ascolto del proprio corpo.

programme.title: Vediamoci chiaro
programme.desc: Scopriamo insieme tutti i consigli e le opinioni su come tutelare i cittadini, e alcuni suggerimenti e soluzioni ai piccoli e grandi problemi delle famiglie.

programme.title: Borghi d'Italia
programme.desc: Un viaggio sul territorio con lo sguardo rivolto alle persone, all'ambiente, al paesaggio al folklore. I borghi italiani visti come comunità e traino semplice, ma forte, di un intero territorio; il tutto dal vivo.

programme.title: Tales of the Dead: Grim Stories of Curses, Horror and Gore
programme.desc: Five friends gather on Halloween to continue their ritual of telling horror stories. Each one telling a more sinister tale than the next, unaware of the horror that awaits them on this all Hallows eve. A film from award winning director Kemal Yildirim. Less is More: May Walker suffers from a disorder known as BIID (Body Integrity Identity Disorder). She has a constant desire to be an amputee to feel complete. She struggles to cope until one day when a mysterious doctor makes her an offer that s impossible to refuse. (Awarded top 10 in the Zone Horror competition and shown at Fright Fest) Wolf Cry: Zack is a slacking teenager who is obsessed with horror movies to the point where nothing else matters. His constant daydreaming derails his life until one night he experiences something that profoundly changes his world forever. Penance: The city is in the grip of a sadist serial killer. Detective Klein is a recovering alcoholic whose career is in tatters until he is chosen by the serial killer to play a horrifying game of cat and mouse. Missing: Five friends investigating an ancient curse on Cromwell Street in England discover far more than they bargained for when they unknowingly unleash a dark force that has been lying dormant for centuries. Includes Special Features.

programme.title: Terror In Woods Creek
programme.desc: In the small town of Woods Creek, terror arrived in 1962 in the form of a mysterious Drifter. A chain of bizarre events & murder ensued then the Drifter left. Now, 50 years later, he has returned.

programme.title: The Jurassic Dead
programme.desc: A unit of mercenaries must team up with a group of tech-geek students after America is struck with an EMP attack. Deep in the desert, they find the source of the terror, a mad scientist.

programme.title: Darkslide
programme.desc: Five best friends, all extreme skateboarders, set out on a road trip to find one of their missing brothers. Their adventure quickly turns into an epic battle for survival.

programme.title: World Mysteries - Pearl Harbor: Surprise Attack or Anticipated Event?
programme.desc: December 7, 1941: The Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, Hawaii devastates the U.S. Pacific Fleet and pushes America into World War II. . The history books fail to explain if the surprise attack was really a surprise. This program addresses that question.

programme.title: World Mysteries - American POWs and MIAs: Dead or Imprisoned?
programme.desc: Official U.S. government policy is that there is no credible evidence that any POWs or those listed as MIA are still alive from World War II, the Korean War or the Vietnam War. Is that a true fact? What is the truth about the fate of our POWs and MIAs.

programme.title: Phoenix Lights: UFO Flyovers or Military Test Flights?
programme.desc: The strange sighting over the southwestern United States in March 1997 called the Phoenix Lights lasted for three hours. Investigators found no plausible explanation. This program presents new footage of the Phoenix Lights that continue to appear.

programme.title: Weather Control: Global Warming or Human Manipulation?
programme.desc: A phased array transmitter stands two hundred miles east of Anchorage, Alaska with the ability to beam more than 3 billion watts of energy into the ionosphere. What is its purpose? Why is this modern-day antennae farm located in this desolate spot.

programme.title: Easter Island Monuments: Native Craftsmen or Other Worldly Creations?
programme.desc: Easter Island is famous for its monumental statues called Moai. These eighty ton monolithic statues were transported several miles and arranged in rows on raised platforms. How did the Rapa Nui create and transport them? Most intriguing is Why.

programme.title: Easter Island Talking Boards: Natural Emigration or Hidden Habitation?
programme.desc: Where did the inhabitants of Easter Island come from 1700 years ago? Is the answer hidden in the hieroglyphics found on the island s legendary talking boards of the islanders Rongorongo language that no scholar has been able to decipher or translate.

programme.title: Weather Control: Global Warming or Human Manipulation?
programme.desc: A phased array transmitter stands two hundred miles east of Anchorage, Alaska with the ability to beam more than 3 billion watts of energy into the ionosphere. What is its purpose? Why is this modern-day antennae farm located in this desolate spot.

programme.title: Inca Civilization: Defeated or Diseased?
programme.desc: The sophisticated Inca civilization thrived for three centuries, had a powerful and dominate military and advanced architectural, mathematical, medical, and astronomical skills. How did Spain s Francisco Pizarro with 168 troops topple this empire in 1532.

programme.title: Dead Walkers: Rise of the Fourth Reich
programme.desc: Reports of a growing terrorist threat in Romania lead the British Secret Service to send in some of their best men, but nobody returns from the field. In a final attempt to get through, Alpha One and Alpha Five are dispatched to try and uncover the truth. What they discover is a bizarre scientific and occult training ground of neo-Nazis descendants of Nazis who fled following their defeat in the Second World War. Over the years they have been researching the energy they call VRIL and utilizing it to grow an army of men and women who cannot be killed, because they're already dead. Attempting to stay under cover and out of sight, Alpha One and Alpha Five come face to face with the terror of the Nazi VRIL soldiers and witness shocking tortures and beatings used to energize the human soul. Mentally twisted, the leaders of this Nazi group are bent on taking over the world with their new VRIL army and bring about the rise of the 4th Reich.

programme.title: The Defiled: We Are All Meat
programme.desc: In a post apocalyptic world, science and technology have backfired leaving unfathomable destruction and a permanently diseased planet in its wake. A virus is mutating the human race turning innocent survivors into mindless cannibals. In a savage future world devoid of hope, a man infected with the deadly viral disease must cope with the burden of a new born son, ensuring his survival. Though he is infected, he does not allow his growing desire for human flesh to overcome his responsibility to the newborn. Along the road, traveling from town to town, he saves an unaffected woman from a certain death by facing down her perpetrators. Ultimately she joins him on his odyssey, a journey through hell on earth in search of a safe haven in which they can perhaps start a life together, both becoming committed to doing whatever it takes to make sure the child survives. Reminiscent of the work of Lynch, Maddin and Tarkovsky, The Defiled is a black and white epic of unparalleled artistry examining life, death and the ultimate sacrifice of love. Not since Carnival of Souls and Night of the Living Dead has a film captured the surreal outer dimensions of the human condition.

programme.title: The Jurassic Dead
programme.desc: A unit of mercenaries must team up with a group of tech-geek students after America is struck with an EMP attack. Deep in the desert, they find the source of the terror, a mad scientist.

programme.title: Zombie Massacre: Army of the Dead
programme.desc: An evil and corrupt U.S. government agency accidentally unleashes a virus on a small town while attempting to perfect a top-secret biological weapon designed to create the perfect army. The experiment goes horrificly wrong, when the advanced biological weapon transforms the residents of a sleepy Maryland town into ravenous flesh-eating Monsters - Zombies so bloodthirsty for human flesh that nothing can stop the carnage. A handful of citizens who have remained uninfected seek sanctuary in a local movie theater, holed up together preparing to make a last stand against the undead. This gore-soaked shocker is not for the squeamish, Zombie Massacre: Army of the Dead will rattle you to your core.

programme.title: Fast Zombies with Guns
programme.desc: Collateral Damage. Sometimes, it s unavoidable. Mobster Kingpin Paul Varlo s (Charles Ramsey) attempt to kill a potential rat by poisoning his personal water supply leads to something he never saw coming an outbreak of zombie carnage! To make matters worse, these zombies are different; they re faster, meaner and they re armed With the town being overrun by fast zombies with guns, one resilient band of people are left to attempt an escape to the nearest undead-free zone and survival.Meanwhile, Jake (Tony Swansey) and his girlfriend Laura (Leena Kurishingal) are cruising their way up to this sweet, little Midwestern town. One quick business transaction with the local mob boss, and they can continue on their way to some fun in the sun, as planned. However, what they discover is a deserted town at first.Will the group survive the terror that has befallen them? Will Jake and Laura get their money?? Will the zombies run out of bullets??? The answers can be found in Fast Zombies with Guns.

programme.title: Terror In Woods Creek
programme.desc: In the small town of Woods Creek, terror arrived in 1962 in the form of a mysterious Drifter. A chain of bizarre events & murder ensued then the Drifter left. Now, 50 years later, he has returned.

programme.title: Max Reload and the Nether Blasters
programme.desc: A small town video game store clerk must go from zero to hero after accidentally unleashing the forces of evil from a cursed Colecovision video game cartridge.

programme.title: The Bisbee Cannibal Club
programme.desc: Vegetarians are disappearing from the little town of Bisbee, AZ. When a group of locals discover that their secret hallucinatory cactus garden has been used as a human barbecue and burial site, the existence of the Bisbee Cannibal Club becomes horrifyingly apparent. They form a vigilante gang, calling themselves The Bisbee Cannibal Hunters, to avenge their garden, save a vegetarian or two from being eaten and try to survive the Cannibal attack from the legions of flesh eaters now running amok. Bonus Features includes the award winning short A Road Kill Cautionary Tale.

programme.title: Melvin
programme.desc: MELVIN is dead... Now, three years after his accidental murder, he is finally making up for lost time. After enlisting the involuntary help of nerdy college student Norton Pincus, he's ready to take on those who are responsible for his death. Melvin's thirst for vengeance will take this dynamic dork duo on a mind-blowing streak of throat ripping, vomit spewing, head decapitating and much, much more. Featuring a cameo by Troma Entertainment's Lloyd Kaufman (The Toxic Avenger, Poultrygeist) and songs from The Sawyer Family, Monday With a Bullet and Double Plus Good. Melvin will teach you that getting picked on at school can be a real killer.

programme.title: Forbidden Science - Age of Cyborgs
programme.desc: Forbidden Science is a unique blend of noir science fiction and erotic programming. Set in the near future, the stories revolve around the evil corporation, 4Ever Innovations, whose young and brilliant scientists download and sell memories. They replace those we've lost with clones and devise technology that helps us live out our greatest fantasies; from saving a failed relationship, to creating the perfect lover, to being irresistible to the opposite sex - but sometimes our deepest desires come at a terrible price. 4Ever offers customers the opportunity to live out their fantasies in a virtual world but there are secrets within 4Ever Innovations that may cost you your life.

programme.title: Medical Mysteries: ancient Healers or Modern Technology?
programme.desc: Cave paintings found in France that depict the use of plants for medicinal purposes carbon-date to 25,000 BC. What did the ancients know? Are there methods and medicines they used that could eliminate some of the most life-threatening illnesses of today.

programme.title: September 11th: Mayhem or Miracles?
programme.desc: The September 11, 2001 attacks impacted American society like no event since Pearl Harbor. This program examines the heroes who emerged amidst the horror of 9-11 and shows the selflessness of everyday men and women under the most adverse conditions.

programme.title: Asteroid Collision: Doomsday Destruction or Passing Apprehension?
programme.desc: There are over 31,000 known meteor impact sites on Earth with craters up to 186 miles in diameter. Some experts say an impact doomsday scenario is science fiction. Others say it is only a question of when . Could humanity survive? Could Earth survive.

programme.title: Mars: Barren Rock or Inhabited Civilization?
programme.desc: Mars has always fascinated humanity. Was there ever life on Mars? Is their life on Mars? This program examines photographic evidence of what appear to be manmade structures on our mysterious neighbor and asks could Mars be a link to another civilization.

programme.title: Medical Mysteries: ancient Healers or Modern Technology?
programme.desc: Cave paintings found in France that depict the use of plants for medicinal purposes carbon-date to 25,000 BC. What did the ancients know? Are there methods and medicines they used that could eliminate some of the most life-threatening illnesses of today.

programme.title: Fast Zombies with Guns
programme.desc: Collateral Damage. Sometimes, it s unavoidable. Mobster Kingpin Paul Varlo s (Charles Ramsey) attempt to kill a potential rat by poisoning his personal water supply leads to something he never saw coming an outbreak of zombie carnage! To make matters worse, these zombies are different; they re faster, meaner and they re armed With the town being overrun by fast zombies with guns, one resilient band of people are left to attempt an escape to the nearest undead-free zone and survival.Meanwhile, Jake (Tony Swansey) and his girlfriend Laura (Leena Kurishingal) are cruising their way up to this sweet, little Midwestern town. One quick business transaction with the local mob boss, and they can continue on their way to some fun in the sun, as planned. However, what they discover is a deserted town at first.Will the group survive the terror that has befallen them? Will Jake and Laura get their money?? Will the zombies run out of bullets??? The answers can be found in Fast Zombies with Guns.

programme.title: Max Reload and the Nether Blasters
programme.desc: A small town video game store clerk must go from zero to hero after accidentally unleashing the forces of evil from a cursed Colecovision video game cartridge.

programme.title: The Defiled: We Are All Meat
programme.desc: In a post apocalyptic world, science and technology have backfired leaving unfathomable destruction and a permanently diseased planet in its wake. A virus is mutating the human race turning innocent survivors into mindless cannibals. In a savage future world devoid of hope, a man infected with the deadly viral disease must cope with the burden of a new born son, ensuring his survival. Though he is infected, he does not allow his growing desire for human flesh to overcome his responsibility to the newborn. Along the road, traveling from town to town, he saves an unaffected woman from a certain death by facing down her perpetrators. Ultimately she joins him on his odyssey, a journey through hell on earth in search of a safe haven in which they can perhaps start a life together, both becoming committed to doing whatever it takes to make sure the child survives. Reminiscent of the work of Lynch, Maddin and Tarkovsky, The Defiled is a black and white epic of unparalleled artistry examining life, death and the ultimate sacrifice of love. Not since Carnival of Souls and Night of the Living Dead has a film captured the surreal outer dimensions of the human condition.

programme.title: Terror In Woods Creek
programme.desc: In the small town of Woods Creek, terror arrived in 1962 in the form of a mysterious Drifter. A chain of bizarre events & murder ensued then the Drifter left. Now, 50 years later, he has returned.

programme.title: Zombie Massacre: Army of the Dead
programme.desc: An evil and corrupt U.S. government agency accidentally unleashes a virus on a small town while attempting to perfect a top-secret biological weapon designed to create the perfect army. The experiment goes horrificly wrong, when the advanced biological weapon transforms the residents of a sleepy Maryland town into ravenous flesh-eating Monsters - Zombies so bloodthirsty for human flesh that nothing can stop the carnage. A handful of citizens who have remained uninfected seek sanctuary in a local movie theater, holed up together preparing to make a last stand against the undead. This gore-soaked shocker is not for the squeamish, Zombie Massacre: Army of the Dead will rattle you to your core.

programme.title: Fast Zombies with Guns

The answers can be found in Fast Zombies with Guns.

programme.title: Tales of the Dead: Grim Stories of Curses, Horror and Gore
programme.desc: Five friends gather on Halloween to continue their ritual of telling horror stories. Each one telling a more sinister tale than the next, unaware of the horror that awaits them on this all Hallows eve. A film from award winning director Kemal Yildirim. Less is More: May Walker suffers from a disorder known as BIID (Body Integrity Identity Disorder). She has a constant desire to be an amputee to feel complete. She struggles to cope until one day when a mysterious doctor makes her an offer that s impossible to refuse. (Awarded top 10 in the Zone Horror competition and shown at Fright Fest) Wolf Cry: Zack is a slacking teenager who is obsessed with horror movies to the point where nothing else matters. His constant daydreaming derails his life until one night he experiences something that profoundly changes his world forever. Penance: The city is in the grip of a sadist serial killer. Detective Klein is a recovering alcoholic whose career is in tatters until he is chosen by the serial killer to play a horrifying game of cat and mouse. Missing: Five friends investigating an ancient curse on Cromwell Street in England discover far more than they bargained for when they unknowingly unleash a dark force that has been lying dormant for centuries. Includes Special Features.

programme.title: The Jurassic Dead
programme.desc: A unit of mercenaries must team up with a group of tech-geek students after America is struck with an EMP attack. Deep in the desert, they find the source of the terror, a mad scientist.

programme.title: Darkslide
programme.desc: Five best friends, all extreme skateboarders, set out on a road trip to find one of their missing brothers. Their adventure quickly turns into an epic battle for survival.

programme.title: The Bisbee Cannibal Club
programme.desc: Vegetarians are disappearing from the little town of Bisbee, AZ. When a group of locals discover that their secret hallucinatory cactus garden has been used as a human barbecue and burial site, the existence of the Bisbee Cannibal Club becomes horrifyingly apparent. They form a vigilante gang, calling themselves The Bisbee Cannibal Hunters, to avenge their garden, save a vegetarian or two from being eaten and try to survive the Cannibal attack from the legions of flesh eaters now running amok. Bonus Features includes the award winning short A Road Kill Cautionary Tale.

programme.title: Melvin
programme.desc: MELVIN is dead... Now, three years after his accidental murder, he is finally making up for lost time. After enlisting the involuntary help of nerdy college student Norton Pincus, he's ready to take on those who are responsible for his death. Melvin's thirst for vengeance will take this dynamic dork duo on a mind-blowing streak of throat ripping, vomit spewing, head decapitating and much, much more. Featuring a cameo by Troma Entertainment's Lloyd Kaufman (The Toxic Avenger, Poultrygeist) and songs from The Sawyer Family, Monday With a Bullet and Double Plus Good. Melvin will teach you that getting picked on at school can be a real killer.

programme.title: Dead Walkers: Rise of the Fourth Reich
programme.desc: Reports of a growing terrorist threat in Romania lead the British Secret Service to send in some of their best men, but nobody returns from the field. In a final attempt to get through, Alpha One and Alpha Five are dispatched to try and uncover the truth. What they discover is a bizarre scientific and occult training ground of neo-Nazis descendants of Nazis who fled following their defeat in the Second World War. Over the years they have been researching the energy they call VRIL and utilizing it to grow an army of men and women who cannot be killed, because they're already dead. Attempting to stay under cover and out of sight, Alpha One and Alpha Five come face to face with the terror of the Nazi VRIL soldiers and witness shocking tortures and beatings used to energize the human soul. Mentally twisted, the leaders of this Nazi group are bent on taking over the world with their new VRIL army and bring about the rise of the 4th Reich.

programme.title: Bigfoot: Living Creature or Legendary Lie?
programme.desc: Bigfoot. Sasquatch. Yeti. Yeren.Yowie. There are reports the world over of these terrifying creatures. This program shows a chilling eyewitness encounter plus scientific analysis of the creature s footprints providing startling insights into this mystery.

programme.title: Mars: Barren Rock or Inhabited Civilization?
programme.desc: Mars has always fascinated humanity. Was there ever life on Mars? Is their life on Mars? This program examines photographic evidence of what appear to be manmade structures on our mysterious neighbor and asks could Mars be a link to another civilization.

programme.title: Killer Insects: Myth or Menace?
programme.desc: Humanity is under attack from the most dangerous insects to ever inhabit Earth. This program examines expert projections that infectious diseases spread by insects could destabilize entire societies and affect worldwide populations for the next 20 years.

programme.title: Egyptian Pyramids: Architectural Wonder or Alien Engineering?
programme.desc: The Pyramids of Egypt are among the largest structures ever built. Archeologists and researchers have determined ancient Egypt lacked the tools and skills required to build the pyramids. So how did the Egyptians build them over four thousand years ago.

programme.title: Bigfoot: Living Creature or Legendary Lie?
programme.desc: Bigfoot. Sasquatch. Yeti. Yeren.Yowie. There are reports the world over of these terrifying creatures. This program shows a chilling eyewitness encounter plus scientific analysis of the creature s footprints providing startling insights into this mystery.

programme.title: Roswell UFO: Weather Balloon or Flying Disc?
programme.desc: What happened at Roswell in July 1947? Did an alien spacecraft crash and the bodies retrieved or was it a weather balloon as authorities later claimed? Could this be the most shocking cover-up of the 20th century? This program examines that question.

programme.title: World Mysteries - Butch Cassidy:Demise By Bullet or Old Age?
programme.desc: Legend says the famous bank and train robbers Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid fled to South America and were killed in a gun battle with Bolivian soldiers. Legend also says they survived. This program examines fact and folklore to resolve this debate.

programme.title: Roswell UFO: Weather Balloon or Flying Disc?

programme.title: MeMaw
programme.desc: MeMaw is the story of a young woman, Jessie, who finds out she is pregnant the same week her grandmother is diagnosed with a terminal illness. She decides to document the progression of her pregnancy during her grandmother s final days to share those special moments with her future daughter.

programme.title: The Invisible Vegan
programme.desc: The Invisible Vegan explores the problem of unhealthy dietary patterns in the African-American community, foregrounding the health and wellness possibilities enabled by plant-based vegan diets and lifestyle choices. programme.title: A Legend in the Classroom: The Life Story of Ms. Yvonne Busch
programme.desc: Born in New Orleans in 1929 and raised in the historic Trem section of the city, Ms. Busch, who mastered several brass instruments and the woodwinds, became a touring professional by the age of 12. programme.title: A THOUSAND MIDNIGHTS
programme.desc: This experimental documentary chronicles the contemporary manifestation of the economic and social histories of Black Americans who came to the north during the Great Migration in search of economic opportunities. programme.title: THE FADE

programme.title: Merry Christmas Britain
programme.desc: Catch up with all the festive news and views from across the United Kingdom.

programme.title: Martin Daubney
programme.desc: Join Martin for an up-to-the-minute take on the day's events delivered in his own unique and lively style.

programme.title: Dewbs & Co
programme.desc: Plain-speaking, straight-talking - Michelle delivers her individual take on the day's news.

programme.title: Lee Anderson's Real World
programme.desc: Lee Anderson brings the Real World to the Great British public, as the silent majority finally have their voices heard.

programme.title: Friday Night Live with Mark Dolan
programme.desc: Join Mark for the biggest stories and debates of the week with a panel of top politicians, comedians and commentators.

programme.title: Patrick Christys Tonight
programme.desc: Join Patrick for two hours of spirited debate and news making interviews. Top guests tackle the issues that matter, with a sharp take on every story.

programme.title: The Last Remaining Lifeboat
programme.desc: John White, from White Star Memories, takes us through the preservation of Nomadic’s last lifeboat. From her discovery in France to her Belfast restoration, White Star’s last remaining lifeboat carries on the legacy.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might..

programme.title: Goodbye Old Man
programme.desc: These incredible words written by the most senior surviving officer of the Titanic, gives us a rare and historic glimpse of the final moments of the senior men that night. It may surprise you to hear just how calm these men really were.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Inquiries and More
programme.desc: In part two of his series on lost documents, Charles Haas looks at other significant collections of Titanic documents that have simply disappeared in one way or another over the years.

programme.title: Thomas Andrews’ Notes - Mark Chirnside
programme.desc: When Olympic made her maiden voyage in June 1911 from Southampton to New York, Thomas Andrews traveled onboard to observe and take notes on potential improvements for Titanic and other ships. Titanic Channel Host Mark Chirnside reveals how the suggested..

programme.title: The Identity Conspiracy
programme.desc: Was Titanic really swapped with Olympic? It’s a conspiracy theory that just will not die! Parks Stephenson may have the eyewitness accounts that will finally put all the conspiracy talk to rest.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Turkish Bath
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Money Troubles
programme.desc: People traveling in 1912 needed to take a lot of cash along on their journey. Unlike today, Europe and America were both cash societies and often that became a problem.

programme.title: An Enduring Mystery
programme.desc: It’s the million-dollar question in maritime history! Who was this ship that sailed close to Titanic and could quite possibly have saved everyone on board? Very few Titanic scholars have looked into this more than Senan Molony. Here’s his take on..

programme.title: A Very Different World
programme.desc: Charles takes us back to 1912 and gives historic insight into how people received the Titanic news. He also makes the case that Titanic may have changed the world of journalism forever.

programme.title: Captain Smith's Saturday Afternoon Ice Briefing
programme.desc: Lightoller’s testimony before the commission confirms Captain Smith’s ice briefing to his officers long before Titanic reached the ice field.

programme.title: Lightoller and Dunkirk
programme.desc: It turns out Titanic was only Act I for Charles Lightoller. Twenty-eight years after Titanic, he was at the helm of his own boat navigating through enemy fire while rescuing British troops from Dunkirk. He was a true British hero.

programme.title: Remembering Ruth Becker Blanchard Part 2
programme.desc: In the second part of this two-part series, Host Ken Marschall continues his remembrance of his friend Ruth Becker Blanchard.

programme.title: The Titanic Baby
programme.desc: Charles Haas remembers his friend Titanic survivor Frank Aks, who was always known as the “Titanic Baby.” Charles gives us the inspiring story of Frank’s life in a touching tribute to a survivor who was given a second chance at life and made the..

programme.title: Was Titanic's Rudder Too Small?
programme.desc: Was the size of Titanic’s rudder the real reason why she couldn’t turn in time to miss the iceberg? Was the rudder just too small for Titanic’s size? Former Naval Ofﬁcer, Parks Stephenson, gives us the answers.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 2
programme.desc: For underwater explorers, the 400-foot dive to Britannic is at the apex of technical diving. Richie Kohler relates his harrowing life and death experience on Britannic in 2009.

programme.title: Did the Lights Stay On?
programme.desc: Parks Stephenson introduces an eyewitness account who says that the lights stayed on in the aft part of Titanic after she broke! Parks also explains how this could have happened.

programme.title: Five Scratches in the Hull
programme.desc: The prevailing theory has always been that Titanic sideswiped the iceberg creating a 300 ft gash along her side. Famed Titanic Explorer, P.H. Nargeolet, discovered five scratches down her side.

programme.title: Titanic's Morse Lamps
programme.desc: Before radio, ships had to communicate with each other visually. During the day they used hand flags and at night it was through morse lamps. Bill Sauder explains Titanic’s Lamps: where they were located and how they were used.

programme.title: How the Wreck Has Changed
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host and famed Titanic Explorer P.H. Nargeolet takes us back down to the wreck for a look at Titanic’s changing conditions and deterioration.

programme.title: Britannic Dive Part 1
programme.desc: Shipwreck explorer, Richie Kohler takes us without a submersible to the warm blue waters of the Aegean Sea and the remarkably preserved HMHS Britannic. Kohler reveals what it’s like to swim freely through the passageways of one of the largest..

programme.title: Mystery Stairs On Titanic
programme.desc: Titanic Channel host Bill Sauder tells us that like any great English house, Titanic had her quirks; including hallways that seem to go nowhere and staircases that served no purposes. What were they thinking? Sauder will explain.

programme.title: Watertight Compartments
programme.desc: Can we design a passenger ship that is truly unsinkable? Parks Stephenson looks at that question as it relates to the design and effectiveness of watertight compartments both in 1912 and today.

programme.title: More Life Boats Would Not Have Helped
programme.desc: Have we been wrong all these years in thinking that more lifeboats would have saved lives? Haas makes a compelling case that this may have been just too simple of an answer.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: Wrought Iron Gates on D Deck
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.

programme.title: Two Bath Tubs
programme.desc: There were only two bathtubs for all 709 Third Class passengers aboard Titanic. Sauder explains why probably no one in Third Class complained.

programme.title: Forward A Deck Promenade
programme.desc: It’s always been suggested that H&W decided to enclose the forward end of Titanic’s A deck promenade because Olympic’s first-class passengers had complained about sea spray. Mark Chirnside believes that might not be the reason and he explains why.

programme.title: Maiden Voyage Handbill
programme.desc: Senan Molony shares a rare artifact of the RMS Titanic and the White Star Line, showing just how important the ship was to commerce over the Atlantic.

programme.title: Titanic's Press Photography
programme.desc: White Star was known for its strong marketing efforts and innovative sales tactics. Titanic interior expert Daniel Klistorner, explains why the photographs taken by the press were so important then and still are today.

programme.title: The Untold Story of the Titanic Deck Chair
programme.desc: The Titanic story goes out in so many different directions and this is one of them! A Titanic deck chair, recovered by the Mackay-Bennett and later auctioned, provides us with a new Titanic Story that you might not have heard before from Craig Sopin.

programme.title: Kicking the Tires
programme.desc: It’s always been debated how much influence Bruce Ismay had on Captain Smith’s operation of the ship on her fateful voyage. Senan Molony gives us a look at a rare photo that may offer some answers.

programme.title: The Lost Documents of Titanic: The Log Books
programme.desc: What could the log books from the Titanic and the Californian tell us today? Would they shed any light on the operations of either ship that night? In part one of this two-part series, Titanic Channel Host and author Charles Haas speculates what we might..

programme.title: The J.J. Davies Bag
programme.desc: As bodies were recovered on the Mackay-Bennett, they were given a number and the personal items found on the body were put into a mortuary bag. This is the real life story of one of those bags from Body No. 200.

programme.title: Memories from the Big Movie Part 2
programme.desc: Ken refers to it simply as the “Big Movie” and without question, it changed his life. In part 2 of this two-part series, Ken describes his feelings walking the decks at Foxs Baja Studios and what it was like working with his friend James Cameron.

programme.title: Titanic Movie Memorabilia
programme.desc: One of the most desired categories of collectibles for Titanic enthusiasts is the growing movie memorabilia market – From the Nazi German Titanic movie in 1943 to James Cameron’s 1997 blockbuster - it’s all out there.

programme.title: Working on the Big Movie
programme.desc: Ken Marschall takes us behind the scenes of James Cameron’s blockbuster movie Titanic. Despite the desire to get everything right, there were a few things done deliberately wrong! For the first time, Ken give us the inside story.

programme.title: Uncommon Courtesy
programme.desc: Many believe the Edwardian society was a rigid system of empty gestures and rituals and was just too restrictive in the lives of people. Well, the Edwardians didn’t quite see it that way. Titanic Channel Host Bill Sauder takes a fascinating look at how..

programme.title: Titanic's Pilot
programme.desc: We hear very little about the Pilots who navigated Titanic out of her harbors. Craig Sopin introduces us to David Smyth, who took Titanic out of Belfast Harbor.

programme.title: Masabumi Hosono
programme.desc: The only Japanese passenger on Titanic helped save lives, but was ostracized back in his home country for the rest of his life. There’s been many published accounts about Hosono, but now Robert Bracken gives us the real story.

programme.title: Was Captain Smith Legally in Command of the Titanic?
programme.desc: Senan Molony has uncovered a completely overlooked Irish document, that seems to confirm Captain Smith was not legally in command of Titanic when she sailed from Southampton on April 10, 1912.

programme.title: What did Marine Superintendent James McGiffin Know?
programme.desc: Why was White Star’s Marine Superintendent at Queenstown never called to give evidence to the British inquiry? After all, he was one of the last White Star representatives to step off Titanic before she sailed. Is this evidence that the inquiry was..

programme.title: Captain Smith's Saturday Afternoon Ice Briefing
programme.desc: Lightoller’s testimony before the commission confirms Captain Smith’s ice briefing to his officers long before Titanic reached the ice field.

programme.desc: One of the features that really set Titanic apart from other ships was her interior illumination. Titanic Channel Host, Bill Sauder, introduces us to a simple, versatile lamp that was used throughout the ship.

programme.title: Surprises Inside Titanic: The Elevator Grills
programme.desc: Ken Marschall continues his series into the remarkable surprises he and James Cameron discovered on their 2001 and 2005 dives to Titanic.
